annotation.TEXT: The boss, aside from being incredibly easy to begin with, is susceptible to the Volt Buckler glitch. In all honesty, I think this sets the tone for the entire game right here: A poorly coded mess with no polish, and only seems to go off the notion that "looking" like a classic fan-game will automatically make it one. Perhaps I'll come back to this game one day, but for now, I'll leave you all with a glimpse into even more of the creator's "incredible" programming skills.

Trust me when I say you're not missing out on much with the other fortress stages. This one sets the mood for all of them: Enemies are clustered in every spot imaginable, seemingly under the pretense that it makes the game more "difficult." Hell, there are so many enemies in this stage that some of them (the Suzies in particular) can actually get stuck on each-other!

In the very least, I can show off the first fortress level. As you can probably tell by that map, there's an overabundance of them (with the "final level" being displayed as an Energy Balancer, which I'm starting to think the creators of this game have an unhealthy obsession with).

For those of you that didn't bother reading my rather lengthy and rage-filled description (I personally don't blame you if you didn't): I'm stopping the playthrough on this game. Normally I don't like to end these series in a premature manner like this, but in the case of this "game," I can't help but make an exception.

I would make a "10/10, would beta test again" joke, but I'm almost positive that absolutely no beta testing occurred during the making of this game. The bottom line however: If you're going to forgo the reliable save feature in favor of a password system, then said passwords need to actually pick you back up where you last left off!
Meanwhile, at the MS Paint factory...

One of the things that put this decision into motion was this particular password. I want you to keep in mind: This is the same password I got in the last segment after defeating Wave Man. Once I use it, I'm pretty sure all you can probably tell what's wrong with it.
